result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Dominique Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence serving.
**07-12-16/JOC amended to reflect a total of 146 days of sentence credit.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carrry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTION CENTER ATTN. STEPHANIE P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO, WI 54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7, Judge Mc.Adams

records.addlTxt: To and from Kevin Williams received and filed.
Original GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (20 pages) commencing 03-14-2016 received and filed. CH
As to the order dated/signed 07-12-16 JOC amended to reflect a total of 146 days of sentence credit.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.

Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in court with attorney William U. Burke.  Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to count 1:      Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Counts 2 and 3 are ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by counsels and defendant.  Letters to the court are presented by defense.
AS TO COUNT 1:
  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 58 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 149 days time served, concurrent with any sentence serving.  CONFINEMENT of 28 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.

Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in court with attorney William U. Burke.  Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF1557 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Robert Crawley-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled  substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Kevin Dominique Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
